question: Describe a time you learnt a useful skills
answer: Learning new skills can always be helpful in order to become a successful person in life. I have also learned a few skills in my life, and I would love to talk about one of them. The skill that I wanna mention is time management skill. Although it is a soft skill that people must have, I do think that many youngsters, thesedays, don't use or master it properly. Essential as it is, but when I was younger, i didn't know anything about this useful skill. Till one day, I was burn out because of the work at the club and tons of homework for the high school. Luckily, when I was down in the dumps, my mother was by my side and taught me about this useful skill. Back in that day, I used to note down the work and set up amount of time to handle that. To be honest, it quite hard to write everything, since I was a forgetful person. After a few week, I could handle every task tasks at school, even my score turned out to be better that day. Since the day that I mastered master that skill, my life has turned is like turning over a new leaf to a new page. And now I'm pleased with what I have achieved. This skill not only keeps people from burnout status but also practice us to have more discipline in work. I know that there are many people assumed to be a procrastinators and they will easily be stressful stress by the volumn of work if they don't deal with it sooner. Another positive result that I have seen is having more quality time with friends or beloved family. Or even I can create me-time to recharge my energy after a long day of hard work Anyway I think that this skill is very useful, mainly because it help my a lot and improve quality of life. In that case, my advice is mastering it at all cost and seeing the differences

question: Describe a short trip you often take but do not like
answer: Back when I was still in secondary school, every weekend I had to take a small journey to my grandpa's house. My grandpa lived alone and since my parents were busy the whole week at work, I was forced to go visit him. I helped him with domestic chores like going for groceries, gardening and cleaning his house. We gonna have lunch together, I used to go shopping for food and then cook his meal for the entire day. Sometimes, we hang out in the park and I help him visit the doctor and take his pills. I really love spending time with him. Though the destination was totally worth it, I am not really enjoying the journey at all. His house was about 30km away from where I live, so every Sunday, at 6:30 in the morning I had to be at the bus station to catch a ride. It took 1 hour to get to his house. It would not be so bad if it was not so bumpy. The road was crowded and the bus stopped frequently, it was also packed with people. It's not comfortable at all, especially in the morning. I had to sit still for 1 hour and the scenery wasn't helped lift my mood any little bit, just bustling road and tedious buildings, it was a really tiring trip for me. Now my grandpa had moved in to live with my family and I had got to high school, far from home, I don't get the chance to take that trip anymore, though I miss the tranquillity of the neighbourhood, I would not like to experience it again.

question: Describe a special building that you have been to
answer: I have been to a very modern building and I’d love to share with you about one of the most symbolic towers in Vietnam, Lotte Tower. As far as I am concerned, this construction is by far the second highest tower in Hanoi, with 65 floors in total. What sets it apart from the others is probably its one-of-a-kind design. Inspired by Vietnamese traditional costume, Lotte Tower has a shape that pretty much resembles the curves of ao dai, which makes it unmistakable in a city full of skyscrapers like Hanoi. Most notably, there is an observation deck located on the 65th floor. It provides us with a panoramic view of the city with a stunning skyline, helping us capture all the beauties of Hanoi into our eyesight. I could give you, like, tons of reasons why I adore this magnificent building. Whenever I feel drained, I feel like riding the elevator to the observation deck to enjoy stunning, unrestricted views of the capital, which would make me feel mentally better.

question: Describe a time you did something rewarding.
answer: I believe that the most rewarding job I have done in the past is helping people and I would like to share my experience of helping a pregnant woman whom I am a complete stranger. A few months ago, on a crowded bus in Hanoi, I helped a pregnant woman carry very heavy things to her house. Since your house is on a high floor but there is no elevator, I asked you cordially if I could help carry things up the stairs. When I gave the things back to the woman and she instinctively said 'thank you very much'. I think she was happy to have someone help her down the stairs when she thanked me deeply a few more times. To be honest, I really felt elated and a joy filled me. I only feel this great feeling when I've actually achieved something extraordinary - I believe that being able to support someone in some way is a great achievement.

question: Tell me about the most important festival in your country.
answer: in my opinion, the lunar new year, or Tet, is Vietnam's largest and most significant festival. during these holidays, people usually come home from large cities to get together with their families, clean their houses, and honor their ancestors, while praying for luck, prosperity, and health in the new year, and giving everyone money as a New Year's Day present. Tet holidays sometimes last 1 to 2 weeks at the end of January according to the solar year.

question: What special food and activities are connected with this festival?
answer: there are a lot of food and activities happening during the Tet holidays. everyone will go to the countryside, make ceremonial offerings to their ancestors, go to the market to buy new clothes or food such as beef, pork, chicken, and pork pies, and make Banh Chung. they also clean the ancestral altar, and their houses to welcome the new year. On the first day of the new year, people will visit each other to give best wishes to each other.

question: What do you most enjoy about it?
answer: on the first day of the lunar new year, I wore new clothes, visit my relatives to give them best wishes for the new year, and played and chat with them while drinking tea and eating kinds of candies. then the older one will give me money as a Tet present. these things are so interesting and make me most enjoy about Tet holidays.

question: Describe a journey you made where you learned something new.

We spent most of the trip enjoying the famous local food in Hai Phong like bánh đa cua, which is a kind(kind of noodle), and local breads like banh mi que bread, local kind of cake, etc, since because this city is  very well-known with the food tour form of tourism. Through this trip, I learned one significant thing that every trip should be planned and budgeted in advance to everyone to be able to enjoy the trip as well as we can.

question: Describe a school you went to in your childhood
answer: Now I'm going to tell you about my primary school, where I spent nearly 5 years during of my childhood. As I can recall, it located in the middle of my hometown so it took me about 20 minutes to cycle to school everyday. In my mind, it was a very beautiful school, all of the walls was painted in bright colors, which made it stand out from the surrounding buildings. Looking from the outside, there was a big blue gate with the school's name above it. Near the gate, there was a parking are where the students and teachers left vehicles before entering the building. I can vividly remember that my old school had a library, a computer laboratory, and a big playground with flowering plants. That was my favorite place because it was a leafy area which can gave me shadow to read comic books during breaktime. question: Describe a technological device you own that has improved your life.
answer: I am going to talk about the Bluetooth AirPods 2 that my elder sister gave me when I passed the high school entrance exam with flying colors. As I can recall, it was on Sunday, and my sister didn’t have to go to work, so she took me to the Cellphone S store where many technological gadgets available there were on sale. As we had discussed what to buy before, my sister bought me one on the spot. At first, it wasn’t that straightforward to use so I had to get my sister to operate it for me. I was blissfully happy to own this device. It was actually two wireless Bluetooth earbuds put in a white plastic case and looked so fancy. It was light and fit perfectly in my palm so I could easily carry it anywhere. In order to keep the AirPods carefully, I bought a Corgi-shaped case to cover it and that was so cute. I have been using it on a daily basis since then and it has done wonders for my English listening skills. I’ve often used it to listen to an English podcast episode before bedtime and the sound was very clear. Also, after school, I put my earbuds on and listen to music while doing the cleaning or when I go jogging in the afternoon. Perhaps thanks to this useful device, I can improve my concentration when listening without being distracted so I really appreciate this gift my sister gave me. Were I to be more financially viable, I would definitely switch to Airpods pro to enhance my experiences.

question: Could you suggest some reasons why some people are deciding to reduce their use of technology?
answer: Although technology has a positive impact on our lives in terms of communication and entertainment, I suppose there are some potential drawbacks to technological gadgets. For the young generation, especially children, are more likely to be distracted from studying because they don’t have the habit of putting restrictions on the amount of time spent on screen. Another reason for this is that it’s been scientifically proven that overuse of the Internet such as social media can be the catalyst for extreme anxiety. That’s why I think it is important for us to cut down on the amount of time using technology.

question: Which programs or apps are most popular in your country?
answer: I believe that there is an ever-widening circle of young adults in Vietnam using social media applications, especially teenagers. It is a norm that such people have a Facebook or Instagram account and often spend several hours per day surfing the newsfeed. I think this is because they can watch reels or chat with their friends or join study groups. However, Vietnamese older people prefer using apps to read online newspapers or video calls with their offspring and grandchildren. And I’m quite sure they even use these features more smoothly than some adults.

question: Should parents limit the time that their children spent on using mobile phones?
answer: Definitely yes. I suppose that it is extremely necessary for parents to put restrictions on the amount of time their kids spend on mobile phones every day. In fact, young children are quite indifferent to the importance of managing screen time and will be more likely to get addicted, so parents should control their time on mobile phone apps to avoid them being distracted from studying. Furthermore, I highly recommend that parents should also patiently explain to their kids about the drawbacks of prolonged screen exposure so they would willingly listen to what they say.

question: Describe an important life event in your country.
answer: Today I'm going to talk about a significant event which occurs in VietNam. It's Tet holiday- one of the traditional occasionsin my countries. Tet holiday will start at the beginning of year Before Tet holiday, dwellers in my country will clean up and decorate their houses because they want throw away a lot of bad lucks last year and give some luck next year. In order to prepare their houses, residents will have many interesting activities,especially they tend to buy some apricot trees or blossom trees. In the first day of Tet holiday, people usually watch the famous TV channel which is See you at the end of the year and watch colourful fireworks then. After that, residents will worship their ancestors with one rooster and one gac sticky rice.  In the afternoon, dwellers will visit their families and friends to exchange their wishes for adult people and give lucky money in red envelope. At the second day of Tet holiday, people usually go to the pagoda to pray for their health, their luck, happiness and prosperity for their family and themselves. It is the most indispensable events in my hometown. Firstly, it is a great occasion for family reunion.Moreover, it 's a good time for everybody to take a break from studying and working

question: What things can make people fall asleep?
answer: People can do a variety of things to help them sleep the most comfortably. However, a comfortable bed is also essential, as are other room components like sound and air. Because you can’t sleep well with noisy sound and hot air around you.

question: Why do some people not get enough sleep?
answer: Our sleep is disrupted for a variety of causes, which results in us not receiving enough sleep, which makes us tired. Our inability to sleep is influenced by psychological and physical issues in addition to well-known causes like stress or deadlines.

question: Why do people sometimes forget important things?
answer: One of the key factors contributing to our forgetfulness, in addition to stress, is not getting enough sleep. If we sleep for less than the recommended 6 hours, our brain won't have enough time to recuperate and work the following day, which can cause forgetfulness.

question: Tell me about the most important festival in your country.
answer: Without a doubt, the most prominent festival in my country is Tet holiday. which is the Vietnamese New Year and a public holiday. There are two things I like about Tet holiday, which is to take a break from school and to enjoy Tet go to Tet. The first thing to mention is going to the Tet market. adults buy new clothes for children and buy candies and fruits to decorate Tet. We are in the north, so we have a typical flower that is peach or kumquat. Students and workers are entitled to 7 days off. This is the time when people who are far away return to their families. We have typical Tet dishes such as banh chung, salted onions, rice paper rolls. When Tet comes, we often send each other best wishes to each other and give lucky money to children. Tet is also an opportunity for people to go to pagodas to wish for a peaceful new year.

question: What special food and activities are connected with this festival?
answer: Chung'cake and 'Tét'cake are the two symbolic representations of Tet in my country. They are both made of the same materials which include sticky rice, meat and beans all tightly packed in Dong leaves. 'Chung' cake is wrapped in a square shape to represent the land. Making 'Chung' and 'Tét' cakes is also one of the typical activities identified with this holiday. Before the festival, every member in the family often gathers around and makes these special cakes together which strongly promotes the family bond.

question: What do you most enjoy about it?

question: Do you think festivals are important for a country? Why?

question: Describe a book or article that you enjoyed reading for your studies
answer: I am going to talk about a book that l’ve read recently. It is a Vietnamese coming-of-age novel called “Mắt Biếc”, which can be literally translated into English as “Blue Eyes”. The novel revolves around an unrequited love story between Ngạn, a country boy, and Hà Lan, his neighbor, childhood friend and lifelong crush. Ngạn and Hà Lan grow up together in a remote village in the Central region of Vietnam. Ngạn develops a strong love, which later becomes obsession, towards Hà Lan, the girl whose eyes he adores since the very first time they meet. Although they spend their childhood and adolescence together, they later lead a very different life during their adulthood. While Ngạn still cherishes the slow-paced life of his village, Hà Lan fails to resist the allure and glamour of the city life. She ends up falling in love with a playboy named Dũng, has a baby with him and leaves the child under the protection of her mom and guess what? Ngạn raises her daughter like his own child just to realized at the end of the story that he is just trying to create another version of his beloved Hà Lan. I really love this novel since I can see parts of younger self in it and the author’s describe of the 1990’s Vietnamese life is just brilliant.

My swimming style is breaststroke and sometimes combined with crawl. I usually warm up with a few simple movements before entering the water to avoid cramps. Beside swim suit, swimming goggles and life jacket are indispensable when I go swimming in the sea to prevent accidents such as cramps, drowning or even rough water. There are many reasons why I love swimming and the first one is that I can blow off steam and boost my mood after a hard working time. Secondly, it has some physical benefits such as building muscle strength, maintaining a healthy weight and so on. Lastly, swimming can improve a good sleep quality as exercise helps reset my body’s internal clock so that I can easy to fall into deep sleep.

question: Describe a time you did something rewarding.
answer: I have always believed that helping others is what makes a kind person,  satisfied with everything we do for others. So I will share my experience of volunteering to help children in Ha Giang. At the end of December last year, the club I joined organized two days one-night charity trip to Ha Giang. We were informed by a friend that many children do not have books to go to school but have to work at home to help their parents. When we saw this happening, we decided to raise money to buy books and learning materials for the little ones. After that, we got on a bus to Ha Giang to help the children. The road that day was fortunately not raining or anything, a day with a little sunshine and cool wind. When I arrived, I was really happy to see the children holding our carefully wrapped gifts. I feel that this trip is worth it, all the effort that we put in is worth it.

question: Describe your favourite sport.
answer: In our daily life, we cannot live without sports because it is very important. It not only improves health but also reduces stress. And the sport that I choose is badminton. This is my favorite sport. This game requires at least two players, or maybe more. Unlike football, badminton does not need too many players and a large space. It only needs a small campus that can be played back and forth and some necessary equipment such as badminton rackets, shuttlecocks, nets, and a marked court. Players will take turns hitting the ball so that it crosses the net until it falls to the ground on the opponent's court to score. Although you may find it extremely easy and simple, this sport is not. It takes a lot of handling skills and body flexibility. Children to the elderly can play this sport to exercise health, flexibility, and entertainment. I often play badminton on weekends for fun, and at the same time, I feel more comfortable after a tiring week of studying. You should try this sport, I am sure it will help you relax and have fun after a stress day of work and study.

question: Describe a sports match that you saw on TV.
answer: I want to tell you about a very special football match. This match happened about 2 years ago, it was a competition between Vietnam and Saudi Arabia team and it was considered to be one of the most unforgettable matches for Vietnamese people. Because this match was held in Chang Zhou in the winter so the weather during this time was very cold for us; in other words, this match may seem to be difficult. To be honest, because it is the first time Vietnam team went to final round in this sport event, so all the residents in Vietnam were extremely looking forward to it, we hoped that our football team could win and become a legend through this match. And as we expected, our team had a brilliant performance in this competition. To illustrate, I was very impressed by a defender called Doan Van Hau who could excellently steal the ball from the opponents. In addition to this, some midfielders also had some great combination that they were able to pass the ball correctly to their teammates. Moreover, thanks to a Korean coach called Park Hangseo who created training sessions a very well trained curriculum to football team, they still played very well in spite of the harsh weather condition. Although our team cannot win this match, they successfully left an impression on to the opponent as well as to Vietnamese people, we were very proud of them. Therefore, after that, all football players in this team were given many a plethora of prizes thanks to their effort such as a huge amount of money, motorcycles even houses.

question: Describe the first day of your school
answer: I spent many years in school, but the first day of college was truly a memorable experience for me. After a nerve-racking period of waiting for the university entrance test result, I finally became a college student and started my new higher education journey.On the first day I came to school, I found everything was so unfamiliar and a lot more crowded than my high school. It took me more than 10 minutes to find my class, and the spacious room with many other students made me feel  a bit out of place. Everyone had a strange face to me, and people did not talk much to each other. I chose a corner in the classroom to  feel more at ease. That day was just the first day of class, so the teacher gave us time to get to know each other. Moreover, she organized a wide range of activities, which catered for students with different interests, preferences and talents. Most activities involved team work, which is great for established friendships and also to develop new friendships by connecting students with funny games. Contrary to my thoughts, most of them were very friendly and outgoing. They were willing to share about themselves, and soon I  became acquainted with a lot of people. Most of our classmates came from different provinces, so we quickly understood the difficulties of living away from home. Moreover, I made friends with two lovely friends, we still stick together all the time until now. That year was completely different from the school years I had experienced, as it marked a big turning point in my life. The first day of college is truly a vivid memory, and I will always remember that remarkable milestone.

question: Describe a special toy you had in your childhood.
answer: Now i'm going to tell you about a special toy I had when I was a child. That was To he, a traditional toy originated from Xuan La village, which was a traditional craft village located only around 40 km from Hanoi centre. As I can recall, my father gave it to me after his business trip to Hanoi. I can vividly remember that To he had the shape of an animal or a fruit. It was made from a special type of rice powder with some natural colors so it was edible. The skilled craftsmen need a mixture which was easily to knead into various eye-catching shapes and stick stuck on bamboo stick. The reason why I think that To he was a special toy is that I live in the central of Vietnam and that was the first time I had seen that kind of toy. It was only ubiquitous in the North and was sold only on two special occasions: Tet holiday and Mid-autumn festival. To he was really a cultural ambassador which let me know more the beauty of Vietnam culture.

question: Describe a school you went to in your childhood
answer: When I was a child, I used to study in a primary school for 5 years that I had most of my childhood memories there. My school was located in the countryside that it took me 20 minutes to commute to school. I had to travel across the paddy fields and river along the way to school that I observed the picturesque landscapes of my hometown. As a result, I would never forget what a beautiful path to school whenever I go on that street. My school was surrounded by the rubber forest which brought the people fresh atmosphere and breathtaking view to see. My school had painted yellow with red roof such as a signature school figure. It was quite small with 2 floors, however, its capacity was about 800 students. In addition, students can play in an enormous playground with adequate facilities for entertaining. Therefore, I spent such a delightful childhood there. Not only did I had fun, but I was also instructed by many loving and passionate teachers. I learned from them from knowledge and life skills such as becoming warm-hearted person. I was taught that if I helped somebody, I would receive happiness. Therefore, I always believe that the more I contribute to the community, the more meaningful my life would be. Although I grew up, I could never forget what they had taught me. I am grateful for having such a memorable time in my childhood.

question: Describe a special toy you had in your childhood.

The plushie appeared such as an endearing bear that every children would love to have as a friend, and I was not an exception. Moreover, the price of it was really expensive for my sisters to buy at that time when they were all students that they had to save money in order to afford it. Whenever I came back home from school, I put it right next to me like a study partner which motivated me to study on my own. I am sincerely grateful for receiving this present and that I appreciate my sisters being so thoughtful and loving me.

question: Describe a piece of international news you recently heard
answer: In today’s fast-paced world, it is essential for an individual to be updated with the latest international news and be aware of the affairs taking place around the world. I would like to talk about the shocking news that I've heard lately, which was about an massive earthquake in Turkey. When I heard the news, I was having dinner with my family. Our family is accustomed with eating breakfast while listening to the morning news on national TV channel. The moment when the disaster in Turkey was shown on the screen, we was very shock. All the buildings collapsed and everything was in confusion. The sky turned grey as it was covered by the dust in the air. The reporter said that in Turkey, the quake sent buildings crumbling, including sections of the Gaziantep Castle, its most famous landmark and a historical symbol of the city. The death toll had reached at least 1,762 people in the country alone, with more than 12,000 others injured. Whenever I listen or read about a catastrophe, I feel so afraid of the mother nature's strength. Is there really nothing human can do to stop nature disasters? My family is deeply saddened by the earthquake's loss of life and devastation caused by the earthquake, and I hope other nations will assist Turkey to overcome this difficult situation.

question: Describe an important car journey that was delayed.
answer: Well, I’m going to tell you about a journey that was delayed. If my memory serves me right, it was 4 months ago, my friend and I decided to take trip to Da Lat as a way to let our hair down after a hard time cramming for the high school entrance exam. This city is quite near my hometown, so we chose to drive there with out private car. When we had already travelled for nearly 2 hours, we suddenly found ourselves driving in an isolated area with no sign of houses or living creatures.  At that time, it started to get darker and colder around us, and I felt like a chill running down my spine.  My friend, the driver, also had the same feeling so he decided to speed up to across this area as soon as possible. During out way, we could hear some whispers somewhere aroud us. Though I tried my best to look for the sources of such sounds, I couldn’t find any clues. Unfortunately, our car was confiscated by the police for 3 days because we drived beyond the speed limit. I tried to call my family but none of them picked up the phone. There’s no other way, we made a decision on grabbing a taxi to came back my town. To be honest, after this accident, we swore to ourselves that we would never travel on that road again

question: Describe a place you have visited where you can see interesting animals.
answer: Now, I’ll talk about the special trip to Vinpearl Safari HL last year, which had brought so many sweet memories of seeing extraordinary animals. I visited there with my family to relieve the stress after my entrance exam in the university. In addition, the reason why I chose that place is because I wanted to discover unusual creatures which I have never seen before. To go Safari, my family need to make a plan carefully for about two months. Vinpearl Sfr HL was so humongous with many people walking around. There were so many big trees with lots of natural shadings which cooled down the atmosphere. But the one that impressed me was the red bridge in the center of the area. We arrived in the morning and decided to wander and check out the zoo. We strolled, chatted and took photos along the way. At the end of the path, we took our seats at one of the shaded areas of the picnic ground and had lunch together. The first encounter I had with the uncommon animals such as tigers and pandas was my most memorable moment. They have different appearances,while the tiger was majestic with a huge and frightened appearance, the panda was so adorable with white and black fur.All of which made them so captivating that I couldn't take my eyes off them. All in all, the expedition turned out amazing. It's one of the most unforgettable memories in my life. The animal’s impressive appearance made me realize the beauty of wilderness.

question: Describe an important car journey that was delayed.
answer: Last year, my parents and I had a plan in advance to go to Ho Chi Minh city. It was an important journey which was the graduation ceremony of my sister. Until now we still cannot believe that it was delayed even after enough planning. The journey, I wanted to take, was meaningful to my family as we would have a family picture at my sister’s university and celebrate her being a truly “adult”. Therefore, the ceremony would remain incomplete if we didn’t attend this ceremony on time. Besides, we also didn’t want to miss any second of my sister’s once-in-a-lifetime-event. So, we made all the plans in advance as we already had booked the tickets to get there and we would have about 2 hours to take a rest before the graduation ceremony. But, despite those plans in advance, the journey was delayed because there was no available coach that could take us there. And, the reason for which we couldn’t get on the coach on time was that there was a traffic jam on the way back to my province. Thankfully, after about an hour of waiting, the coach finally appeared. Honestly, I felt a bit disappointed and impatient after my journey was delayed. But, even though, it was delayed, it was such a waste of time which was not only for my family but also the passengers going with us. I also felt lucky that we could still attend whole part of the graduation ceremony although we were tired a little bit because the lack of rest.

question: Describe a person you admire.
answer: If you ask me who has been the greatest admiration to me, I will say my father. For me, my dad is a very delicate husband and father. He always puts his family first. I feel like he's willing to do everything to make his wife and children smile. Although he has to work super hard during the day, he always makes time for me and my mother. Besides, my dad is a very hard-working person. He gets up pretty early at about 5 A.M every morning and he normally works at least ten hours a day on your farm. You know, farming for a living in hard work, especially during summertime when the temperature can go up to nearly 40 degrees which is extremely hot. Working outdoors in these conditions is such a nightmare. Although my dad has to work super hard to support the family, I have never heard him complain about his work or things like that. All the things make me always hold my father in high esteem. And I have learned a great deal from my dad. You know, being a farmer's daughter, I understand the value of hard work. My dad is always a good role model for me. Actually, there's so many things I could talk about, but I know I don't have enough time for it.
